title: 8 adorable and funny ways to dress up your pregnant bump for Halloween
text:
CLOSE

Your bump is your best accessory this Halloween. (Photo: Motherhood Maternity)

Being pregnant during Halloween is probably the most exciting time to be carrying a little bundle of joy. Yes, because you're bringing life into this world, but also because your baby bump can be used as a prop for the festive holiday.

There are plenty of ways your bump can serve as a darn good accessory. If your child is going to make you go through nine months of pregnancy and childbirth, you may as well have a little fun with it, right?

Here are just a few ways you can dress up when you're pregnant.

Pumpkin

This one is obvious. Halloween, pumpkins, a round bump—it just makes sense. Make it yourself by decorating an orange shirt. Or you can purchase one.

Skeleton with a baby skeleton

You can still be spooky while pregnant. If you're all about the DIY, dress up in all black and outline the skeletal anatomy in white. When it comes to your belly, draw a baby skeleton, of course. You can also just buy one too.

Mother Earth

I mean, you are giving birth to an important being so you're basically Mother Earth already. Grab a long white cloth and wrap it around yourself so that your belly peeks out, then paint (or have someone else do it) your bump blue and green so it looks like a globe.

Basketball net

We're telling you, the bump can be used for anything at this point. Decorate your belly so that it looks like a bright orange basketball. Then grab a crop top and hang netting similar to a basketball net on the bottom of it and let it hang over your belly (basketball).

If you have a Halloween partner in crime, make them dress up as their favorite ball player.

Gumball machine

Grab a white top and red bottoms and cover your belly in colorful poof balls. For a cute partner costume, have your person dress up as a quarter.

Avocado

Before dressing up as an avocado, be forewarned that you may suddenly have millennials following you around with a hunger in their eyes.

To pull off the avocado look, just wear an all brown outfit and make a cardboard or styrofoam cut-out of an avocado, but instead of coloring in the pit, make a whole instead. Place the avocado around your neck like a sandwich board and make sure your brown belly peeks out from the hole.

Miley Cyrus' wrecking ball

Your baby's about to come into your life like a wrecking ball pretty soon, so may as well dress them up like one now.

Wear all black, cut out a circular patch of grey or metallic cloth that's the size of your belly and stick it on your bump. Then get a silver chain and attach it to the grey ball. Make sure you get a barbie doll dressed in a white tank (like Miley in the "Wrecking Ball" music video) and get it to intertwine with the chain too.

Baseball player

This is a unique take on dressing up like a baseball player. Wear your favorite MLB player's outfit, but when it comes to your belly, decorate it so it looks like an actual baseball.

Prego pasta sauce

Get it? For this one, just wear all red (or you can simplify it by wearing a red top) and decorate it with your favorite sauce ingredients: green pepper, tomato, mushrooms, etc. Then just write the words "Prego" across your shirt and you're done.
